# Arpeggio: Major 7b5 in E

## Brief Presentation
The Major 7b5 arpeggio in the key of E is a four-note arpeggio that consists of the notes E, G#, B, and Db. This arpeggio creates a unique tonality that combines the lush sound of a major 7th chord with a diminished 5th interval. It is often used to add tension and color to musical compositions.

## Notes and Intervals
- E (Root)
- G# (Major 3rd)
- B (Perfect 5th)
- Db (Major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Major 7b5 arpeggio is commonly used in jazz and fusion genres due to its dissonant and complex sound. It adds a sense of sophistication and intrigue to musical compositions, making it a favorite among composers and improvisers looking to inject a bit of flavor into their music. The tension created by the diminished 5th interval gives the arpeggio a mysterious and edgy quality that can evoke a variety of emotions in the listener.
